intro: Reichardia hexapetala, commonly known as the six-petaled dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to eastern North America and is characterized by its yellow, composite flower heads that resemble those of a dandelion. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Reichardia hexapetala is a perennial herb that produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution.
